newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore oil exports up 8.2 pct in Sept from Aug.
newsitem.headline: Singapore oil exports up 8.2 pct in Sept from Aug.

text.p: The value of Singapore's oil exports in September rose a nominal 8.2 percent to S$1.311 billion from a month-earlier S$1.211, data from the Trade Development Board (TDB) showed on Monday.
The September exports were 26.3 percent higher than the year-earlier exports, the figures showed.
In real terms, September oil exports were 7.3 percent higher at S$1.894 billion from August's S$1.765 billion. The September figure was 8.6 percent higher in real term than the year-earlier level.
The TDB attributed the oil export growth to "the escalation of oil price in the aftermath of the U.S.-Iraq conflict."
The United States fired missiles on southern Iraq in the first week of September in relatiation for Iraq's incursion against Kurds in the north of the country.
The attack prompted prompt Brent crude futures to rise to a five-year high.
